decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer combo to quickly mill the opponent's deck, filling their graveyard with creatures like Prized Amalgam and Silversmote Ghoul. With cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution, the deck can easily find and play its key combo pieces. By sacrificing creatures and utilizing powerful spells like Turntimber Symbiosis and Sea Gate Restoration, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with creatures and outvalue them. Overall, the deck aims to combo off quickly and efficiently to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate large amounts of mana combined with untap effects to draw through the deck quickly. The primary win condition is through either Jace, Wielder of Mysteries or Thassa's Oracle, using cards like Peer into the Abyss to quickly draw through the deck and win the game. The deck also includes cards to help find Lotus Field, such as Sylvan Scrying and Strategic Planning, and ways to interact with the opponent's board, like Blast Zone and Blink of an Eye.

This mono black aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion, Knight of the Ebon Legion, and Spawn of Mayhem to pressure the opponent's life total. Utilizing disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to clear the path for your creatures, while also having powerful threats like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Murderous Rider to provide additional reach and removal. With a streamlined mana base and versatile removal options, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient offense.

The primary focus of the deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Wilderness Reclamation allows for additional mana generation during the opponent's end step, enabling the player to cast multiple spells in a single turn. The deck also features powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Shark Typhoon to apply pressure and close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main idea of this Pioneer 1 vs 1 Spirit Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy centered around powerful Spirit creatures. By boosting each other with abilities like flying and anthems, the Spirits aim to quickly build a threatening board presence while disrupting the opponent's plans with counterspells and protection effects. The deck emphasizes tempo and evasion to finish the game quickly and efficiently before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through counterspells and removal while ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation. The key concept is to establish a strong board presence with powerful threats like Teferi, Omnath, and Uro while generating card advantage and finishing the game with explosive spells like Expansion / Explosion or Shark Typhoon. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by consistently answering their threats and overwhelming them with its own powerful spells.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to control the game through various removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with hand disruption like Thoughtseize. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and value through cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy. Additionally, by utilizing cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald, the deck can efficiently search for important pieces and threats. The deck also includes threats like Shark Typhoon and Tireless Tracker to close out the game once it has control.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. It also utilizes card advantage engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and Dig Through Time to pull ahead in resources. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional value by blinking permanents like Omen of the Sea and Shark Typhoon. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color requirements and maximize consistency.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing early mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to ramp into powerful threats like Glorybringer and Questing Beast. Cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Embercleave provide additional reach and removal options to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of haste creatures and pump spells like Reckless Bushwhacker and Atarka's Command, the deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to establish a board presence and maintain tempo with low-cost spirit creatures. By utilizing cards like Supreme Phantom and Empyrean Eagle to boost the power of spirits, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with evasive threats. Cards like Spell Queller and Skyclave Apparition provide disruption and removal, allowing the deck to maintain control of the battlefield. Collected Company provides additional creature options and can lead to explosive turns, while Lofty Denial offers a counterplay option for opponents' spells. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck looks to pressure opponents and secure victories quickly.

This deck focuses on utilizing various self-mill and graveyard recursion strategies to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, allowing for explosive combo plays with Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle trigger. The deck aims to consistently and efficiently set up this combo, utilizing cards like Eldritch Evolution, Neoform, and Creeping Chill to disrupt opponents and control the board while assembling the necessary pieces for the combo finish.

This deck focuses on curving out with aggressive creatures like Bloodsoaked Champion, Dread Wanderer, and Knight of the Ebon Legion to put pressure on the opponent. It includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes recursive threats like Scrapheap Scrounger and Rankle, Master of Pranks to maintain a steady stream of pressure. With efficient removal spells like Murderous Rider and Heartless Act, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a strong board presence to close out the game quickly.

The main focus of the deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation. The deck utilizes a combination of instants, sorceries, and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional card advantage and life gain, while Shark Typhoon offers a win condition in the form of flying tokens. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistency in mana production.

This Pioneer Aggro-Auras deck focuses on playing cheap creatures and enchanting them with powerful auras to quickly build a strong board presence. The key strategy is to use cards like All That Glitters, Ethereal Armor, and Gryff's Boon to pump up your creatures and overwhelm your opponent. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide additional value by recurring your auras from the graveyard. By utilizing these synergies, the deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain momentum to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on using auras to buff up creatures quickly and efficiently, leading to a fast-paced aggressive strategy to overwhelm opponents. With a focus on adding multiple auras to a single creature, it aims to create a powerful threat that can quickly end the game. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of versatility and recursion to the deck, allowing for even more aggressive plays.
